item.title: Okayu Nyumu! for PC to be released in English on August 7
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/okayu-nyumu-for-pc-to-be-released-in-english-on-august-7

  • PC

Currently available for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC in Japan.

Entergram will release the PC version of Okayu Nyumu! via Steam in English on August 7, the developer announced.

Okayu Nyumu! first launched for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC on February 27 in Japan. While the game was only available physically via a special edition for Switch and PC, Entergram announced it will also release standard physical edition for Switch on August 7 in Japan.

An English release for the PlayStation 4 and Switch versions were not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

Story

One fateful day, our protagonist chanced upon a strange cat.

A stray cat with a beautiful lavender coat and an empty stomach.

Our protagonist decided to share the rice ball he was holding with the cat.

The next day, he woke up to find…

A girl with cat ears sleeping blissfully under the same blanket as him.

The girl, Nekomata Okayu, tells him she has nowhere to go, and so they begin living together.

With the introduction of the mysterious Okayu, our protagonist’s uneventful life will never be the same.

What secrets does Okayu hold? How will their relationship develop? This is a story about the budding bond between the two—more than friends but less than lovers—as they tackle life, sharing both tears and laughter.

Get ready for a heartwarming story about living with Nekomata Okayu!

System

A visual novel with a fully-voiced storyline.

Enjoy the rich story that branches off from one chapter to the next.

Controls

  • Left click / Enter – Next page
  • Right click / Space – Hide window
  • Ctrl – Skip
  • Auto, Save, and other buttons – Left-click to operate according to button

Visit the English official website here.

item.title: FuRyu Team Noir teases new school life RPG to be announced on April 23
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/furyu-team-noir-teases-new-school-life-rpg-to-be-announced-on-april-23

Team Noir, the FuRyu development team behind Monark, will announce a new school life RPG on April 23 at 8:00 a.m. PT / 11:00 a.m. ET / April 24 at 00:00 JST, the developer teased. A teaser website is now available.

The game will feature background music by Tsukasa Masuko, a scenario by Gakuto Mikumo and Ryuutarou Itou, and scenario supervision by Kazunari Suzuki, as well as at least eight to be announced character theme song composers.

item.title: Bases Loaded and Super Bases Loaded collection Jaleco Sports: Bases Loaded announced for PC, now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/bases-loaded-and-super-bases-loaded-collection-jaleco-sports-bases-loaded-announced-for-pc-now-available

  • PC

Available at a 20 percent-off launch discount price.

Publisher Rock It Games, in cooperation with City Connection, and developer Sickhead Games have announced Bases Loaded and Super Bases Loaded collection Jaleco Sports: Bases Loaded. It is available now for PC via Steam and GOG at a 20 percent-off discount price of $10.39 until May 2, after which it will cost $12.99.

“Bases Loaded and Super Bases Loaded have left a lasting legacy in sports gaming, and we’re very excited to work with City Connection to bring these classics to PC players,” said Rock It Games CEO Michael Devine in a press release. “Rock It Games is making sure to preserve the original charm of each game while making them easily accessible to fans both old and new.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the collection, via its store pages:

About

America’s favorite pastime is back in season and now available on Steam!

Enjoy the legendary throwback pack of the esteemed Bases Loaded games for Nintendo Entertainment System and Super Nintendo Entertainment System.

The baseball series that set the standard for sports games! Featuring smooth animations, fast-paced arcade action, and a unique behind-the-pitcher camera view, Bases Loaded delivers the thrill of America’s pastime like never before.

Key Features

  • Bases Loaded (Nintendo Entertainment System, 1988)
    • Realistic retro voice, action, and graphics.
    • Unique television-style presentation.
    • Play against the computer or a friend.
    • Pick your team from 12 different lineups.
    • Select your lineup from 30 unique players.
    • Each ball player has his own style.
    • Control and play any position.
  • Super Bases Loaded (Super Nintendo Entertainment System, 1991)
    • All-new center field TV perspective.
    • Rates your skill in 13 categories.
    • Five increasingly difficult levels of play.
    • Pick from 13 different teams.
    • Watch mode to see the computer play itself.
    • Unique “radar” feature that shows location of fielders.
    • New strategies allow you to customize your team.
    • Authentic Baseball Action – Feel the excitement of every pitch, hit, and home run with intuitive controls and strategic gameplay.
    • Seamlessly switch between the Nintendo Entertainment System and Super Nintendo Entertainment System versions anytime.
    • Need help? A built-in manual is always ready to guide you!
    • Retro CRT Mode – Play with a classic TV filter for the ultimate 90s nostalgia.

Whether you’re a longtime fan of Bases Loaded or a newcomer ready to experience one of the most beloved baseball franchises, it’s time to grab your bat, step into the box, and swing for the fences!

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Switch 2 pre-orders begin April 24 in the U.S. and Canada, pricing unchanged
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/switch-2-pre-orders-begin-april-24-in-the-us-and-canada-pricing-unchanged

  • Switch 2

Switch 2 accessories to experience price adjustments, however.

Pre-orders for Switch 2 will open on April 24 in the United States and Canada, Nintendo announced. Pricing will remain the same as initially announced—$449.99 for the Switch 2 console, or $499.99 for the Switch 2 and Mario Kart World bundle. Pricing for both the physical and digital versions of Mario Kart World ($79.99) and Donkey Kong Bananza ($69.99) will also remain unchanged at launch.

Switch 2 accessories, however, will experience price adjustments from those announced on April 2 in the United States “due to changes in market conditions.” Other adjustments to the price of any Nintendo product are also possible in the future depending on market conditions.

Here are Nintendo’s manufacturer’s suggested retail prices as of April 18, 2025:

  • Nintendo Switch 2 – $449.99 / CAD$629.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle – $499.99 / CAD$699.99
  • Mario Kart World – $79.99 / CAD$109.99
  • Donkey Kong Bananza – $69.99 / CAD$99.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller – $84.99 / CAD$109.99
  • Joy-Con 2 Pair – $94.99 / CAD$124.99
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip – $39.99 / CAD$49.99
  • Joy-Con 2 Strap – $13.99 / CAD$19.99
  • Joy-Con 2 Wheel Set – $24.99 / CAD$29.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Camera – $54.99 / CAD$69.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Dock Set – $119.99 / CAD$154.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Carrying Case & Screen Protector – $39.99 / CAD$49.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 All-In-One Carrying Case – $84.99 / CAD$109.99
  • Nintendo Switch 2 AC Adapter – $34.99 / CAD$39.99
  • Samsung microSD Express Card (256GB) for Nintendo Switch 2 – $59.99 / CAD$84.99

Switch 2 will launch on June 5.

item.title: FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time ‘Life Spotlight: Rookie Adventurer’s Play Breakdown’ trailer

https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/fantasy-life-i-the-girl-who-steals-time-life-spotlight-rookie-adventurers-play-breakdown-trailer

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Follow fledgling adventurer Lif on his journey as a Mercenary.

Publisher LEVEL-5 and developer LEVEL-5 Osaka Office have released a new trailer for social slow-life RPG FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time dubbed “Life Spotlight: Rookie Adventurer’s Play Breakdown.”

The video features commentator Quinton Starr, who follows fledgling adventurer Lif on his journey as a Mercenary.

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 21. It will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, French, Italian, German, and Spanish language options. Digital pre-orders opened earlier today. Read more about the game here.
